meanings.sent1: The puppy was tractably trained to sit and stay.
meanings.sent2: The teacher found the students to be tractably quiet during the test.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten, surprisingly, behaved tractably during the vet visit.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were tractably calm, like a serene lake on a windless day.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces fit together tractably, creating a perfect picture.

meanings.definition: Capable of being handled or dealt with efficiently
meanings.sent1: The new software was designed to be tractably user-friendly.
meanings.sent2: The manager appreciated how tractably the team completed the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The robot vacuum cleaner worked tractably, efficiently cleaning every corner.
meanings.sent4: Her mind processed the information tractably, like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The instructions were laid out tractably, making assembly a breeze.
